attributes.action: Hold governments legally accountable for breaking manifesto promises
attributes.additional_details: Political parties often make election promises to win votes but face no consequences when they break them. Voters deserve a democratic mechanism to hold governments to account between elections. This would improve transparency, trust, and democratic integrity to a system that many feel is letting down the public.
attributes.background: Create an independent, legally recognised body to assess whether elected governments are delivering on their manifesto promises. If a government breaks significant promises without reasonable justification, this body should trigger public recourse, including potential re-elections.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Require election & manifesto pledges to be implemented and legally enforced
